about.summary: An implementation of the nodiv algorithm, see Borregaard, M.K., Rahbek, C., Fjeldsaa, J., Parra, J.L., Whittaker, R.J. & Graham, C.H. 2014. Node-based analysis of species distributions. Methods in Ecology and Evolution 5(11): 1225-1235. <DOI:10.1111/2041-210X.12283>. Package for phylogenetic analysis of species distributions. The main function goes through each node in the phylogeny, compares the distributions of the two descendant nodes, and compares the result to a null model. This highlights nodes where major distributional divergence have occurred. The distributional divergence for these nodes is mapped using the SOS statistic.

name: r-nodiv
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.3.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-nodiv
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/nodiv_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/nodiv/nodiv_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 03e8674619d95b7c4175520c57da95078f56cb207a5a8649fab93c7a5dc31dfc

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ape
    - r-picante
    - r-raster
    - r-sp
    - r-vegan
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ape
    - r-picante
    - r-raster
    - r-sp
    - r-vegan

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('nodiv')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('nodiv')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/mkborregaard/nodiv
  license: MIT
  summary: 'An implementation of the nodiv algorithm, see Borregaard, M.K., Rahbek, C., Fjeldsaa,
    J., Parra, J.L., Whittaker, R.J. & Graham, C.H. 2014. Node-based analysis of species
    distributions. Methods in Ecology and Evolution 5(11): 1225-1235. <DOI:10.1111/2041-210X.12283>.
    Package for phylogenetic analysis of species distributions. The main function goes
    through each node in the phylogeny, compares the distributions of the two descendant
    nodes, and compares the result to a null model. This highlights nodes where major
    distributional divergence have occurred. The distributional divergence for these
    nodes is mapped using the SOS statistic.'
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - jenzopr

# Package: nodiv
# Type: Package
# Title: Compares the Distribution of Sister Clades Through a Phylogeny
# Version: 1.3.0
# Date: 2018-11-07
# Author: Michael Krabbe Borregaard
# Maintainer: Michael Krabbe Borregaard <mkborregaard@snm.ku.dk>
# Description: An implementation of the nodiv algorithm, see Borregaard, M.K., Rahbek, C., Fjeldsaa, J., Parra, J.L., Whittaker, R.J. & Graham, C.H. 2014. Node-based analysis of species distributions. Methods in Ecology and Evolution 5(11): 1225-1235. <DOI:10.1111/2041-210X.12283>. Package for phylogenetic analysis of species distributions. The main function goes through each node in the phylogeny, compares the distributions of the two descendant nodes, and compares the result to a null model. This highlights nodes where major distributional divergence have occurred. The distributional divergence for these nodes is mapped using the SOS statistic.
# Depends: R (>= 3.0)
# Imports: picante, raster, ape, sp, vegan, utils
# Suggests: RColorBrewer, parallel, testthat, colorspace
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# URL: https://github.com/mkborregaard/nodiv
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2018-11-07 09:41:35 UTC; michael
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2018-11-07 10:00:02 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
